availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and county sheriff. Kentucky native. Married to Sally Sarah Gudgell Harper on September 14, 1846. Father of James Harper, Walter Harper, Morton Harper, Charles Harper, and Mary Harper. Farmer in Bath County in 1850 and 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Bath County in 1860. Sheriff of Bath County in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 109B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 11.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 4.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville Precinct, p. 10-11.
Legislative Document, No. 15: Testimony take in the contested election case of B. D. Lacy against Lander Barber, and ordered to be printed by the House of Representatives, December 20, 1865 (Frankfort, KY: State Printing Office, George D. Prentice, 1865), p. 3.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000273005, p. 367.
Find A Grave, "Daniel Harper (1826-1912)," Memorial #69743119, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69743119# (accessed September 20, 2018).
